body:
> However the proposed alias feature is not unique to Go, other languages did not get less adoption cause of aliases(none that I know of).

Just commenting on that one point being cheeky, but there are a lot of features in other languages that are arguably bad ideas but do not deter people from adopting these languages.

Being somewhat more serious now, it would be interesting to see what are the aliases actually used for in other languages, with specific examples of the machinery involved and how package/module boundaries are impacted. Without that, it is going to be difficult for people to accept such a proposal.
